input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Education level has a direct effect on skill. Skill has a direct effect on salary. The overall probability of college degree or higher is 88%. The probability of high school degree or lower and high salary is 5%. The probability of college degree or higher and high salary is 50%. Is the chance of high salary smaller when observing college degree or higher?
